name: The Redbury

reviews.text: If you are looking for a hotel smack dab in the center of cliche Hollywood, look no further. Located at the famous intersection of Hollywood and Vine, The Redbury is a boutique hotel that offers very spacious studio apartment-like rooms complete with seating area and laundry machines. All rooms are equipped with full kitchens as well...and yes, that bar counter doubles as a dance stage complete with polished chrome stripper pole. Expect to pay $37/night for valet parking. If you are planning on clubbing/partying while you stay the hotel is within walking distance of Katsuya (owned by the same entertainment group) Sayers Club (same entertainment group, again), Geisha House, The Piano Bar, Edun, and Drais. It's also around the corner from the Pantages Theater. This is a small boutique hotel with big big rooms, but the guest to staff ratio is large and there never seems to be more than 2 people at the lobby desk, and 2 attendants at the valet kiosk...it's more than enough though. I didn't eat at Cleo, the hotel restaurant, but I did order room service for breakfast and thought it was all adequately delicious.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Rooms...and a stripper pole!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Redbury recently and found it a great place to stay. The rooms are incredibly large as the building was intended to be a condo location. Everything was just as advertised.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: The staff members were very personable and helpful.
reviews.title: A* all the way....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great location for anyone going to the Pantages theater as it is right across the street.
reviews.title: Redbury is ace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Redbury is a great hotel for anyone looking for a neat place to stay in the Hollywood area.
reviews.title: Great hotel, awful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place! The decor is a super eclectic funky vintage Hollywood music chic. My room was spacious and oh so clean! With modern accents and awesome mood lighting it sported a cool kitchen with four barstools around the island off a comfy living room. Loved the panel draped balcony over a sweet courtyard. The cool poster bed gave a great night's sleep. I wanted to stay so much longer!
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I've stayed at The Redbury and I travel all over the world & stay at the best hotels. (I am a regular guest at the #1 hotel in the nation located in Chicago -- was initially The Elysian which is now the Chicago Waldorf Astoria, so I know the best hotels!) The Redbury is in a great location to see the hip Hollywood area of L.A. The spacious bedrooms are suites with interiors that are decorated in a very cool, retro-inspired, chic bohemian Hollywood-glam style. I like & have used (the off premise complimentary for hotel guests) 24Hr. Fitness facility just a half mile from the hotel. Also, The Cleo restaurant is a trendy restaurant with excellent tapas style cuisine. But, what I like best about this place is the great staff -- from the valets to the night manager. They are so very accommodating & truly care about their guests. The only negative thing is if you are not a music lover than I would not stay there unless you would like to pay extra for a room away from the music lounge courtyard. Because most rooms face their balcony overlooking an outdoor lounge area that have live bands entertaining at least 3 nights/wk. So, if you are looking for a quiet or relaxing place then this lively cool boutique may not be for you. I highly recommend this place for someone who loves a lively, fun, hip cool unique experience.
reviews.title: Very chic, cool boutique hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful accommodation, we had no problems with the room which had a kitchen (though basic equipment), decorated beautifully, great bathroom, it was really lovely, the website photos are a great indication of the look of the rooms. Good value rooms too. The staff were fantastic, very helpful! Positioned in a great location, and the restuarant Cleo in the hotel is suppose to be the hotest restuarant in the area at the moment run by an Aussie chef, and we enjoyed a lovely meal one night! It was incredible accommodation! BUT! sadly it is positioned next to a music club and when we were there they had something playing Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights. The worst night was Saturday the music didn't finish until 5.30am and thats when we finally fell asleep - however when we mentioned this to staff they ensured we were looked after to make up for it! Also, because the floors were wood, we found that our upstairs neighbours were heavy footed and from 4am some mornings could hear them stomping about! Otherwise, ask for a room facing away from the music club and I think it's accommodation worth staying at!
reviews.title: Fantastic Accommodation! But . . . .
Nice boutique hotel but missing the details
reviews.text: The Redbury is a nice boutique hotel right in Hollywood. I stayed in a Highland Flat, which was very spacious. The room had a full kitchen, a living room with a couch and two chairs, the bedroom, and a nice bathroom. The shower is huge with a rainfall shower head. The room itself was great but it was the small details that were irritating. The room had gnats in it, enough that it was bothersome. Not sure where they came from but definitely not something I want in my room. The other thing I noticed was the room could have been cleaned better. I realize this is me being very picky but you would think the room would be spotless since it's cleaned everyday. Even with the few negatives I would come back. The size of the room is great for what you pay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this amazing hotel for the last 3 nights of our CA trip.
reviews.title: Totally and Utterly Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was in August at the end of a 5 week trip so we were very much delighted to be shown to such a glamourous room/apartment. The rooms are a visual feast with much thought having been put into the furnishings and trimmings. We loved the old style record player along with a selection of LPs. We loved the big bathroom and generous shower and large sized amenities were a bonus, sad that we only had one night to enjoy them.
reviews.title: Hollywood Glam

reviews.text: We enjoyed a long walk down Hollywood Bvld looking at the pavement stars, though it was a wrench to leave the room!
reviews.title: Awesome Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in september this year with our 1 year old daughter. Having a full kitchen and laundry with a massive lounge area was perfect for travel with a little one. The rooms were stylish and well decorated with neat little features like a record player. We found the staff friendly and attentive. The attention to little details made the stay great. Great location if you plan to take a look around hollywood boulevard and explore the hollywood area.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't eat at the restaurant or take in the nightlife in the area so can't comment on that. We liked the place so much we were going to book an extra couple of nights but no rooms were available. Would totally recommend this place.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Our stay at the Redbury was our first night of 30 nights in the USA & Canada from Australia. We rated the Redbury as our best overnight stay. Not bad when we also stayed at the Fairmont Chateau (Lake Louise) and the Palmer House in Chicago. While it doesn't have the vista that the Fairmont enjoys, it's digs were far superior. We enjoyed a fully equipped kitchen, a huge walk in shower, a separate toilet and comfortable bed. The decor was quirky and well done with a real homely feel. All this within a short stroll to all the Hollywood has to offer. This has prompted us to avoid the larger hotel chains in future and seek out hotels such as the Redbury. The staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommend this great hotel.
reviews.title: Great - however
W.O.W.
reviews.text: The Redbury has to be my all time favorite hotel. We do a lot of traveling for business. And a lot of it in LA. The Redbury is absolutely stunning and flawlessly designed to make you feel right at home ... In the home of your dreams!! My only negative comment is they're sold out next week so we can't go back there!!

We rented out 3 rooms at Redbury for our friends bachelorette party and there were 14 girls. When we arrived the valet basically knew that "we" were the bachelorette party and the hotel is expecting us. They helped us with everything and everyone was greeting us and saying "have a great time!' Our room was really spacious and cute. It is decorated really eclectic with a modern twist. We brought a pole dancer up to our room to teach us some pole moves and everyone was able to be in the room comfortably. We went out for the night and when we came back we headed to the second floor to check out Cleo's before closing. The bouncer wouldn't let these three girls in because they were closing up, but when we flashed our room key they let us right through. It made us feel very VIP. Then we headed up to the bar for some shots and the bartender was cute and laughing it up with us. We were basically the last people out of there. I the rooms are really clean and staff is great so no complaints here. The only thing I would throw out is instead of having a record player with old records to get an iPod speaker system.
reviews.title: Great for Bachelorette Party!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were jut blown away by the unbelievable service and absolutely unique atmosphere! The room accommodations were like a little home away fom home! Great location and fantastic restaurant in the bottom floor. We were leaving the Redbury to stay at the Ritz in San Francisco and honestly didn't want to leave! We will definitely return and have told all our friends about this wonderful place they should all experience.
reviews.title: Best kept Secret!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very good, namely the rooms which are spacious, clean, with balconies (yay!) and they are special, done in the old Hollywood style from the pictures to the sofas and four poster beds. An experience in itself and a nice respite from the impersonal style the big chains offer. The location is good too, easy access to main Hollywood attractions, bars, restaurants. Even public transport is close for those who might be traveling without a car. On the other hand, you should be aware that Redbury is first and foremost a night club. With the exception of Sundays and possibly Mondays, the place comes alive after 9 pm and the music is banging loud till 2 am. The majority of rooms have balconies facing the courtyard where the club scene is developing. Forget getting to bed early, We didn't mind since we were either out or went to bed really late but we did appreciate the Sunday when all was quiet for a change. We also can agree with many reviewers here that the staff is nice and willing to help out but we had an impression that the club visitors had a priority. I'd recommend the hotel for a short stay due to the location and quality of the premises but for a longer stay I'd choose something quieter. Also, the hotel is rather pricey. As elsewhere in Hollywood, the rooms seem a tad overpriced. No pool in this hotel so perhaps they should either consider adding one or rethink the pricing policy. But what is really a bit on the outrageous side is the 37 dollar overnight valet parking. Find a cheaper option close by, there are several possibilities, just follow the public parking signs.
reviews.title: For night owls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hip hotel on the corner of Hollywood and Vine and were more than impressed with all they offered. From the valet attendants and their input into the area to the smooth check-in, first impressions set the tone for the rest of the visit. The room was like staying in your own loft, with a wonderful kitchen and complete bar offerings (just don't be surprised at the $35 half-bottle of red). We ordered room service twice and, while the food from Cleo was good, the presentation in your own dining room was lovely.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, wonderful experience.

aka: The Redbury @ Hollywood And Vine Hotel
